skillTree.localised_description: "Those horrible gits will rue the day!"

skillTree.localised_description: "They'll be 'ruined' alright - by me, with my mighty axe!"

skillTree.localised_description: "What to do, what to do? You just won't stay dead, will you? Diiiiie!!!"

skillTree.localised_description: "So ungrateful - after all we've done for them! Time to teach the umgi a lesson they won't forget!"

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
All Dwarfs are stubborn, but none more so than Grudgebearer, the founder of the Age of Reckoning.
A true Lord knows the Underway, his Dwarfhold and how to fight under the ground better than anyone.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when fighting against Skaven
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 during subterranean siege battles
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 during subterranean intercept battles
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This stubborn Dwarf refuses to yield or tire, and ensures his followers are of the same ilk.
The endless courage of the Warrior God, directed to bolster this Dawi’s own reserves.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A throwback to the High Kings of old, Thorgrim seeks to unite the Karaks and reclaim their lost Holds.
"That which is wrong with the world that cannot be fixed with the blades of our axes, we shall surely avenge!"

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Thanes
	(all provinces)

Upkeep: -15% for Longbeards and Hammerers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Mighty vengeance requires some truly serious firepower.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Master Engineers
	(all provinces)

Missile strength: +5% for Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In his noble, avowed quest to return Karaz Ankor to its former glories, Thorgrim has commissioned research into new and improved engineering and runecraft.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Runesmiths
	(all provinces)
Age of Reckoning Grudge Settler army size: +3

skillTree.localised_description: Long has the High King yearned to avenge the wrongs done to his people by striking clean the entire ledger of the Great Book of Grudges!

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +20% after winning a battle

Attribute: Unbreakable when fighting against enemies with 1000+ Grudges
	(own army)

Attribute: Perfect Vigour when fighting against enemies with 1000+ Grudges
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: These armour plates have been girded with runes to ensure the wearer is protected from all manner of attacks.
Dawi of distinction tend to have the best weapons, whether made specially for them or taken as spoils from their defeated foes.
This Lord's ability to withstand prolonged combat and show fortitude has a positive effect on those fighting nearby.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Dwarfs are resolute - once they commit to charging the foe, they put all their strength behind that initial blow.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
All Dwarfs despise the Greenskins, for the urki and grobi are the prime agents in the Times of Woe.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Greenskins
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
Dwarfs are not fast, yet they will soldier on, always moving despite any hazards encountered.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Lord and his az are never separated, for it is as much part of him as his beard.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Dwarf spent time in the pits, gaining a Miner's intuition of the dangers and prey to be found in the dark.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: Thorgrim Grudgebearer is the current High King of the Dwarfs. He is a throwback to the High Kings of old - eager for new conquests, mighty in battle, and a merciless enemy.

items.colour_text: Before Grimnir disappeared into the north, he gifted his son Morgrim one of his legendary axes. It has been passed down to each High King ever since.

item_set.description: The High-King unites all Dawi, wreathed in the glory of the Ancestors.
